website_summaries.verdict: One of the fastest lenses in a Leica compact camera, this classic-looking model takes available light and turns photographs into works of art.
pros: Integrated WiFi allows for transfer of images to a smart phone or tablet
Comes with a mini-flash, although camera's ability to take photos in low light means it's not necessary most of the time
Can shoot in auto mode or use manually
cons: Extensive menu of functions may take some time to learn
Fixed lens is a dealbreaker for some photographers

customer_reviews.title: I rarely use a flash but, I finally needed ...
customer_reviews.text: I rarely use a flash but, I finally needed to use the flash unit that came with the camera. It does not work. Apparently this is a common problem with this camera based on my Google search results. Unfortunately, I missed my window of opportunity to return the unit by about a month and eligibility for support expired last month. Typical. I think the quality of the camera is highly overrated. I would not buy another one and now l am wary of the Leica brand in general.
customer_reviews.author: bookgoblin

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, fun learning experience even though I've owned ...
customer_reviews.text: Great camera, fun learning experience even though I've owned many cameras in my life-this is my first Leica and I want to make sure I understand it thoroughly. Adorama sent it in pristine condition. Only disappointment and not Adoramas' fault is the "free" version of Adobe Lightroom is really just a 90 day trial as it's now cloud based so once the 90 days is up it's a subscription based program.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Stewart

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY FROM THIS SELLER
customer_reviews.text: this camera is a fantastic camera.... but do NOT purchase anything from this seller!!! They tried to scam me out of a “restocking fee” when I never even opened the box. You will love this camera, just buy it from someone else who is honest and gives you a chance to at least open it to see if you like it!! I had this camera model for years before it was stolen from my car, it’s an awesome point and shoot takes amazing pictures, highly recommend from an honest seller
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I though pricy but not any more.
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera. First off I'm a point and shoot type of person now, however I've owned SLR's and numerous lenses. What I truly appereciate is the lense (1.7) on this thing. No flash needed so far and it's been 3 months. Pictures are perfect 95% of the time the remaining 5% is user error. I now have a desire to use "stop action" shutter speed control and changing "depth of field" arpeture control. Manuel mode wow, I thought I was done with that. Ease of use great when want it and ease of Manuel use is terrific. My only complaint is the pics and movies now need a new home on iCloud or biggg hard drives.
customer_reviews.author: William D.

customer_reviews.title: nice new camera
customer_reviews.text: nice new camera, love it. It is a second model of the same, the first did not work too well, hope this one will! Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Milan

customer_reviews.title: It's an affordable Leica.  A Leica!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is easy to use once you learn all the buttons. Very fast apurture, great in low light. Very solid, crisp lens, easy to grip, low profile looks. By that I mean it does not look like a fancy expensive camera, maybe discouraging thieves.
customer_reviews.author: James Magee

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Nine aperture blades, no fidgety P-A-S-M wheel, traditional top plate controls for exposure compensation and shutter speed, clicky aperture dial on AF lens in 1/3 stop increments, f1.7, multi-aspect 4/3s sensor. All the elements of a traditional camera in a compact size with Leica logo. I LOVE THIS CAMERA!
customer_reviews.author: A. Krupa

customer_reviews.title: Nothing finer than Leica
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little camera. So many options, very confusing and complicated, it will take awhile to learn. I had a Leica film camera that I loved. Welcome to the 21st century.
customer_reviews.author: Allan

customer_reviews.title: Prosumer features in a point and shoot body.
customer_reviews.text: After reading many reviews I looked closer at the Panasonic Lumix and the Leica D-Lux, finally deciding to purchase the Leica. The warranty and the Lightbox download made it worth the extra money (to me). I use Manual mode extensively to photograph the products I sell. The Leica makes it very convenient to manage everything without using the menu system - a huge plus for me. Rock solid feel, perfect layout of controls and excellent picture quality. A bit awkward to hold though. I have ordered a grip from J. B. Designs and hope that solves the problem. It's half the price of the Leica grip and more interesting to look at... IMO.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Awesome retro camera that takes awesome pictures
customer_reviews.text: Awesome retro camera that takes awesome pictures. The camera performance is great at low light and the menu is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Darren M

customer_reviews.title: Great service
customer_reviews.text: I liked the competitive price on this start up Leica kit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Leica compact digital camera ever!
customer_reviews.text: I have and have had a number of the small Leica compact digital cameras over time, and this is by far the most professional-feeling and performing of them all. My earlier Leica compact cameras all worked well, but were lightweights by comparison to the new Leica D-Lux (I also have the original 2003 Leica D-Lux as well as others). I only wish the optical zoom range were greater, but this is normally not a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Phbug

customer_reviews.title: Great compact digital camera
customer_reviews.text: Great compact digital camera. I added the leica grip and a newer thumb grip to improve the handling. With an aperature ring and shutter speed knob, the camera is much more intuitive and is more like a film camera Image quality is good so far in my tests.Going to semi-retire my DSLR cameras.
customer_reviews.author: dino

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite camera
customer_reviews.text: My new D109 replaces my year older D6. The D6 was fun and fabulous as a compact, low light, perfect exposure wonder, but my new 109 is far superior. The fact that my new compact gives me full creative control, is twice as good at hand held low light situations, and has a larger sensor makes this my SLR replacement camera. The one downside is the need to carry the separate flash unit. I would prefer a slightly larger body to have a built in flash.
customer_reviews.author: R. Lee

customer_reviews.title: An Artist's Camera
customer_reviews.text: My best camera purchase ever. This little camera has it all, especially all important settings on the camera and not buried in the menu. It takes exceptional photographs and capabilities allow lots of experimentation! I think it's an artist's camera.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Love the retro look and it's a Leica
customer_reviews.text: More bang for less bucks. Features galore. Love the retro look and it's a Leica.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey Nesossi

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great camera with many features. Well, made and light weight. However, Leica needs to make a better user manual.
customer_reviews.author: Gaten J. Maffei

customer_reviews.title: A fine pedigree: Leica D-Lux
customer_reviews.text: August 2015 Did not realize this was an "International model", which means no warranty. You are on your own if you ever need repairs to this camera. Have had it for only a few days, it appears to be a very fine camera, with many features I have not yet explored. I will update this review after I use the camera more. It appears to be a serious contender in the mirrorless camera category, at a hefty price.

customer_reviews.title: Amazon.com and Murphys Camera A team
customer_reviews.text: As always product is fantastic, Murphys Camera delivered product earlier than expected. Amazon has been reliable, dependable and best pricing. Leica speaks for itself, have used products over the years, made my Holidays picture perfect.

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: When I first opened, it showed vertical lines and is flashing. Flickering. Initially I thought there's a warm up period. But when I started taking pictures, the lines and pink colors also appear on the image taken. I took the camera to Leica at Soho, NY, and they said this operation is not normal. I hope this is a remote experience. I'm in the process of returning the camera.

customer_reviews.text: DOA...Diopter was free wheeling. It didn't work so the EVF was useless and I immediately returned the camera. After I returned it, I noticed the same problem in a review on the LX100 so this could be an issue with the camera.

customer_reviews.title: One of the best travel camera
customer_reviews.text: One of the best travel camera. The f/1.7-2.8 Leica Lens 24-75mm (35mm Equivalent), larger 4/3" MOS Sensor and the weight 12.87 oz / 365 g without battery are the 3 factors that I am sold. The lens cap Leica Auto Lens Cap for D-Lux is a must. The Leica Handgrip for D-LUX (Typ 109) Digital Camera adds about 90 gms to the weight so better option is custom handgrip from Richard Franiec (tecsol@comcast.net) for $34.95 (see attach pictures).

customer_reviews.title: From M to D...
customer_reviews.text: Nowadays, Leica are made in Japan, some cheaper models were even made in China. I am a Leica fan and collector. I have in my collection of more than 30 cameras. The last one was a M-9P. It uses a Russian made battery. Lens from Panasonic. Camera costs more than $10,000. So much so for Leica for me. This D-Lux was bought and quickly returned.

customer_reviews.title: the ultimate point and shoot
customer_reviews.text: yes. im finally giving up my dslr with heavy L prime lenses for 90% of my shooting. the fit, finish, features, interface, colors and image quality are just awesome. nothing more to say. just try it and youll get one - of of corse, it is most definately not made in china. i hope the next version will offer an even faster lens and a bit more resolution. ill be the first in line to buy it.

customer_reviews.title: works very nicely. The Panasonic Lumix DMC-LX100 works just as well
customer_reviews.text: Small, lightweight camera. The autofocus doesn't always work with me. Haven't used the viewfinder once. Otherwise, works very nicely. The Panasonic Lumix DMC-LX100 works just as well, this Leica is just an "updated" version. Though, for the price I prefer the Panasonic.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little camera
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a camera with a flexible lens and small enough to nearly fit in your pocket. This camera is everything and then-some. It's compact. Shoots great in low light. (I comes with a flash but i've never used it) The video quality on it is amazing. People are jealous when they see your photos. Order it!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew S

customer_reviews.title: Leica does not provide any - at all - support ...
customer_reviews.text: Leica does not provide any - at all - support on japanese equipment after 5 years. This is therefore NOT a timeless device of the brand name leica. This is a stepson of M with a very limited lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Kutay Demiroren

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, way overpriced. Buy the Lumix version.
customer_reviews.text: NOTE: The low rating is not because this is a bad camera, but because Leica charges $600 more than Lumix, who sells the exact same camera (Lumix LX100) for $599. The Lumix warranty is shorter and Adobe Lightroom is not included but this is a much better buy. Plus, I think that Lightroom is now a subscription, which you will have to renew for $99 every year. The camera itself is fantastic. Great image quality, superb build, nice size (Sony RX100 is TOO small), 4k video, and a great, fast 1.7 lens. Rated by DP Reviews as the best compact zoom they have ever reviewed. Check out image examples online– they compare to those from a DSLR.
customer_reviews.author: Thurston Howell III
